bug.author: damochiz
bug.summary: "Deploy a model to Azure Container Instances" link does not exist
bug.description:
Clicking the link "Deploy a model to Azure Container Instances" accesses the following URL, but displays the page if it does not exist. URL: <denchmark-link:https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/python/api/azureml-core/%5Bhttps://docs.microsoft.com/azure/machine-learning/service/how-to-deploy-azure-container-instance%5D(https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/machine-learning/service/how-to-deploy-azure-container-instance)?view=azure-ml-py>https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/python/api/azureml-core/%5Bhttps://docs.microsoft.com/azure/machine-learning/service/how-to-deploy-azure-container-instance%5D(https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/machine-learning/service/how-to-deploy-azure-container-instance)?view=azure-ml-py</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h4>Document Details</denchmark-h>

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/damochiz>@damochiz</denchmark-link> Thanks for the feedback! We are currently investigating and will update you shortly.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/j-martens>@j-martens</denchmark-link> Hi Josee, could you please help us fix this page? Thanks.
A fix is in the works. Thanks for pointing this out.
Fix will appear in next release in 1-2 weeks. Thanks.
Fix has been applied, I'll proceed to close this issue.
